programme.title: Motorsport F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie introduces coverage of the Japanese Grand Prix from the Suzuka circuit. McLaren's Lewis Hamilton is a previous winner, although his victory came at the Fuji Speedway circuit in 2007. Last year he managed a third-place finish here, but it was Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel who took the honours ahead of Jarno Trulli. With Ferrari's Fernando Alonso another previous winner at this famously-demanding circuit, expect the competition to be fierce as the season nears its climax(n)

programme.title: Vanarama National League
programme.desc: Maidenhead United, debutants in the Vanarama National League, host Hartlepool United at York Road. This is Hartlepool's first campaign outside the Football League in 96 years.(n)

programme.title: Premier League
programme.desc: Brighton kick off life in the Premier League against Pep Guardiola's Manchester City at the Amex Stadium. Kyle Walker, Bernardo Silva and Ederson could debut for big-spending City.(n)

programme.title: Premier League Tonight

programme.desc: The latest news and action from the FIA World Rally Championship, plus a look ahead to Rally Germany.(n)

programme.title: Bundesliga Preview
programme.desc: A profile of RB Leipzig ahead of the new Bundesliga campaign. Leipzig, arguably German football's most reviled club, secured second-place in their maiden season in the top tier.(n)

programme.title: German Cup Football
programme.desc: Third-tier Chemnitzer FC host Bayern Munich in the DFB-Pokal first round. Bayern will hope to bounce back from a rocky pre-season which included defeats to Arsenal and Liverpool.(n)

programme.title: Ligue 1
programme.desc: Claudio Ranieri chases his first win as Nantes manager against Marseille at the Stade de la Beaujoire in Ligue 1. Ranieri suffered a poor start to his tenure, losing 3-0 to Lille.(n)

programme.title: Live Ligue 1
programme.desc: Marcelo Bielsa resumes his Lille revolution as they face Strasbourg in Ligue 1. Bielsa signed over 12 players this summer and has quickly implemented an exciting brand of football.(n)

programme.title: Live Ligue 1
programme.desc: Dijon and Monaco clash in Ligue 1 at the Stade Gaston Gerard. In-demand star Kylian Mbappe is one to watch here as Monaco go in search of their second consecutive victory.(n)

programme.title: The WRC Magazine
programme.desc: The latest news and action from the FIA World Rally Championship, plus a look ahead to Rally Germany.(n)

programme.title: Bundesliga: Games of the Season
programme.desc: We revisit the Bundesliga clash between Borussia Dortmund and Bayer Leverkusen at the Westfalenstadion. Leverkusen were 2-0 winners in the reverse fixture.(n)

programme.title: Bundesliga: Games of the Season
programme.desc: We revisit the Bundesliga clash between Bayer Leverkusen and Wolfsburg at the BayArena. A late Tin Jedvaj strike secured a 2-1 win for Leverkusen in the reverse fixture.(n)

programme.title: Serie A: Games of the Season
programme.desc: We revisit March's controversy-filled clash between Juventus and AC Milan in Turin. The hosts, looking to extend their lead at the top, were unbeaten in 30 Serie A home matches.(n)

programme.title: Serie A: Games of the Season
programme.desc: We revisit March's enthralling match between Empoli and Napoli at the Stadio Carlo Castellani. The clash featured a stunning performance by Napoli star Lorenzo Insigne.(n)
